name: py-torch

conflicts.name: +tensorpipe
conflicts.description: py-torch: TensorPipe not supported until ROCm 5.2

conflicts.name: ~tensorpipe
conflicts.description: py-torch: TensorPipe must be enabled with +distributed

conflicts.name: cuda_arch=none
conflicts.description: py-torch: Must specify CUDA compute capabilities of your GPU, see https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-gpus

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: metal
variants.description: Use Metal for Caffe2 iOS build

variants.name: mps
variants.description: Use MPS for macOS build (requires full Xcode suite)

description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.

dependencies.name: llvm-amdgpu
dependencies.description:
Toolkit for the construction of highly optimized compilers, optimizers,
and run-time environments.

dependencies.name: hsa-rocr-dev
dependencies.description:
This repository includes the user mode API nterfaces and libraries
necessary for host applications to launch computer kernels to available
HSA ROCm kernel agents.AMD Heterogeneous System Architecture HSA - Linux
HSA Runtime for Boltzmann (ROCm) platforms.

dependencies.name: hip
dependencies.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-astunparse
dependencies.description:
An AST unparser for Python. This is a factored out version of unparse
found in the Python source distribution; under Demo/parser in Python 2
and under Tools/parser in Python 3.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: py-pyyaml
dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.name: py-requests
dependencies.description: Python HTTP for Humans.

dependencies.name: py-cffi
dependencies.description: Foreign Function Interface for Python calling C code

dependencies.name: py-future
dependencies.description: Clean single-source support for Python 3 and 2

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: py-filelock
dependencies.description:
A platform-independent file lock for Python. This package contains a
single module, which implements a platform independent file lock in
Python, which provides a simple way of inter-process communication

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependencies.name: py-sympy
dependencies.description: SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics.

dependencies.name: py-networkx
dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: py-jinja2
dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.

dependencies.name: py-fsspec
dependencies.description: A specification for pythonic filesystems.

dependencies.name: py-tqdm
dependencies.description: A Fast, Extensible Progress Meter

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
Automatically Tuned Linear Algebra Software, generic shared ATLAS is an
approach for the automatic generation and optimization of numerical
software. Currently ATLAS supplies optimized versions for the complete
set of linear algebra kernels known as the Basic Linear Algebra
Subroutines (BLAS), and a subset of the linear algebra routines in the
LAPACK library.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
Automatically Tuned Linear Algebra Software, generic shared ATLAS is an
approach for the automatic generation and optimization of numerical
software. Currently ATLAS supplies optimized versions for the complete
set of linear algebra kernels known as the Basic Linear Algebra
Subroutines (BLAS), and a subset of the linear algebra routines in the
LAPACK library.

dependencies.name: py-pybind11
dependencies.description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependencies.name: py-protobuf
dependencies.description:
Protocol buffers are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral,
extensible mechanism for serializing structured data - think XML, but
smaller, faster, and simpler. You define how you want your data to be
structured once, then you can use special generated source code to
easily write and read your structured data to and from a variety of data
streams and using a variety of languages.

dependencies.name: protobuf
dependencies.description: Google's data interchange format.

dependencies.name: eigen
dependencies.description:
Eigen is a C++ template library for linear algebra matrices, vectors,
numerical solvers, and related algorithms.

dependencies.name: fp16
dependencies.description:
FP16 is a header-only library for conversion to/from half-precision
floating point formats

dependencies.name: pthreadpool
dependencies.description: pthreadpool is a portable and efficient thread pool implementation.

dependencies.name: psimd
dependencies.description: Portable 128-bit SIMD intrinsics.

dependencies.name: fxdiv
dependencies.description:
Header-only library for division via fixed-point multiplication by
inverse.

dependencies.name: benchmark
dependencies.description: A microbenchmark support library

dependencies.name: cudnn
dependencies.description:
NVIDIA cuDNN is a GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural
networks

dependencies.name: magma
dependencies.description:
The MAGMA project aims to develop a dense linear algebra library similar
to LAPACK but for heterogeneous/hybrid architectures, starting with
current "Multicore+GPU" systems.

dependencies.name: nccl
dependencies.description: Optimized primitives for collective multi-GPU communication.

dependencies.name: numactl
dependencies.description: NUMA support for Linux

dependencies.name: llvm-openmp
dependencies.description:
The OpenMP subproject of LLVM contains the components required to build
an executable OpenMP program that are outside the compiler itself.

dependencies.name: valgrind
dependencies.description:
An instrumentation framework for building dynamic analysis. There are
Valgrind tools that can automatically detect many memory management and
threading bugs, and profile your programs in detail. You can also use
Valgrind to build new tools. Valgrind is Open Source / Free Software,
and is freely available under the GNU General Public License, version 2.

dependencies.name: rccl
dependencies.description:
RCCL (pronounced "Rickle") is a stand-alone library of standard
collective communication routines for GPUs, implementing all-reduce,
all-gather, reduce, broadcast, and reduce-scatter.

dependencies.name: rocprim
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute Parallel Primitives Library

dependencies.name: hipcub
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute Parallel Primitives Library

dependencies.name: rocthrust
dependencies.description:
Thrust is a parallel algorithm library. This library has been ported to
HIP/ROCm platform, which uses the rocPRIM library. The HIP ported
library works on HIP/ROCm platforms

dependencies.name: roctracer-dev
dependencies.description:
ROC-tracer library: Runtimes Generic Callback/Activity APIs. The goal of
the implementation is to provide a generic independent from specific
runtime profiler to trace API and asyncronous activity.

dependencies.name: rocrand
dependencies.description:
The rocRAND project provides functions that generate pseudo-random and
quasi-random numbers.

dependencies.name: hipsparse
dependencies.description:
hipSPARSE is a SPARSE marshalling library, with multiple supported
backends

dependencies.name: hipfft
dependencies.description:
hipFFT is an FFT marshalling library. Currently, hipFFT supports either
rocFFT or cuFFT as backends.hipFFT exports an interface that does not
require the client to change, regardless of the chosen backend. It sits
between the application and the backend FFT library, marshalling inputs
into the backend and results back to the application.

dependencies.name: rocfft
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute FFT library

dependencies.name: rocblas
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute BLAS library

dependencies.name: miopen-hip
dependencies.description: AMD's library for high performance machine learning primitives.

dependencies.name: rocminfo
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute (ROCm) Runtime rocminfo tool

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description: MSMPI is a Windows port of MPICH provided by the Windows team

dependencies.name: gloo
dependencies.description: Gloo is a collective communications library.

dependencies.name: mkl
dependencies.description:
Intel oneAPI Math Kernel Library (Intel oneMKL; formerly Intel Math
Kernel Library or Intel MKL), is a library of optimized math routines
for science, engineering, and financial applications. Core math
functions include BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, sparse solvers, fast Fourier
transforms, and vector math. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and
using this software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the
software license agreements at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: py-hypothesis
dependencies.description: A library for property based testing.

dependencies.name: py-psutil
dependencies.description:
psutil is a cross-platform library for retrieving information on running
processes and system utilization (CPU, memory, disks, network) in
Python.

dependent_to.name: ams
dependent_to.description: AMS Autonomous Multiscale Framework.

dependent_to.name: py-colossalai
dependent_to.description:
An integrated large-scale model training system with efficient
parallelization techniques.

dependent_to.name: py-linear-operator
dependent_to.description:
A linear operator implementation, primarily designed for finite-
dimensional positive definite operators (i.e. kernel matrices).

dependent_to.name: py-botorch
dependent_to.description: BoTorch is a library for Bayesian Optimization built on PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained models for
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-pathml
dependent_to.description: An open-source toolkit for computational pathology and machine learning.

dependent_to.name: py-efficientnet-pytorch
dependent_to.description: EfficientNet implemented in PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-torchmeta
dependent_to.description:
A collection of extensions and data-loaders for few-shot learning &
meta-learning in PyTorch. Torchmeta contains popular meta-learning
benchmarks, fully compatible with both torchvision and PyTorch's
DataLoader.

dependent_to.name: py-deepecho
dependent_to.description:
DeepEcho is a Synthetic Data Generation Python library for mixed-type,
multivariate time series.

dependent_to.name: py-ultralytics
dependent_to.description:
Ultralytics YOLOv8, developed by Ultralytics, is a cutting-edge, state-
of-the-art (SOTA) model that builds upon the success of previous YOLO
versions and introduces new features and improvements to further boost
performance and flexibility. YOLOv8 is designed to be fast, accurate,
and easy to use, making it an excellent choice for a wide range of
object detection, image segmentation and image classification tasks.

dependent_to.name: mlperf-deepcam
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch implementation for the climate segmentation benchmark, based on
the Exascale Deep Learning for Climate Analytics

dependent_to.name: cradl
dependent_to.description:
The CRADL proxy application captured performance metrics during
inference on data from multiphysics codes, specifically ALE
hydrodynamics codes.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-sparse
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a small extension library of optimized sparse
matrix operations with autograd support.

dependent_to.name: py-keras
dependent_to.description:
Multi-backend Keras. Keras 3 is a new multi-backend implementation of
the Keras API, with support for TensorFlow, JAX, and PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-mxfold2
dependent_to.description:
MXfold2: RNA secondary structure prediction using deep learning with
thermodynamic integration

dependent_to.name: py-horovod
dependent_to.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.

dependent_to.name: py-lightly
dependent_to.description: A deep learning package for self-supervised learning.

dependent_to.name: py-visdom
dependent_to.description:
Visdom aims to facilitate visualization of (remote) data with an
emphasis on supporting scientific experimentation.

dependent_to.name: py-torchdata
dependent_to.description: Composable data loading modules for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-timm
dependent_to.description: (Unofficial) PyTorch Image Models.

dependent_to.name: minigan
dependent_to.description:
miniGAN is a generative adversarial network code developed as part of
the Exascale Computing Project's (ECP) ExaLearn project at Sandia
National Laboratories.

dependent_to.name: py-lightning-lite
dependent_to.description:
LightningLite enables pure PyTorch users to scale their existing code on
any kind of device while retaining full control over their own loops and
optimization logic.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-nvidia-apex
dependent_to.description:
A PyTorch Extension: Tools for easy mixed precision and distributed
training in Pytorch

dependent_to.name: topaz
dependent_to.description:
topaz: Pipeline for particle picking in cryo-electron microscopy images
using convolutional neural networks trained from positive and unlabeled
examples. Also featuring micrograph and tomogram denoising with DNNs.

dependent_to.name: py-torchbenchmark
dependent_to.description:
A collection of open source benchmarks used to evaluate PyTorch
performance.

dependent_to.name: redis-ai
dependent_to.description: A Redis module for serving tensors and executing deep learning graphs

dependent_to.name: py-torchvision
dependent_to.description: Image and video datasets and models for torch deep learning.

dependent_to.name: py-alpaca-farm
dependent_to.description:
AlpacaFarm is a simulator that enables research and development on
learning from feedback at a fraction of the usual cost, promoting
accessible research on instruction following and alignment.

dependent_to.name: py-dalib
dependent_to.description:
Trans-Learn is a Transfer Learning library based on pure PyTorch with
high performance and friendly API.

dependent_to.name: py-ocp-models
dependent_to.description:
Reference implementation for the MLPerf HPC OpenCatalyst DimeNet++
benchmark

dependent_to.name: py-torchdiffeq
dependent_to.description: ODE solvers and adjoint sensitivity analysis in PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-geometric
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch Geometric (PyG) is a geometric deep learning extension library
for PyTorch. It consists of various methods for deep learning on graphs
and other irregular structures, also known as geometric deep learning,
from a variety of published papers. In addition, it consists of an easy-
to-use mini-batch loader for many small and single giant graphs, multi
gpu-support, a large number of common benchmark datasets (based on
simple interfaces to create your own), and helpful transforms, both for
learning on arbitrary graphs as well as on 3D meshes or point clouds.

dependent_to.name: py-melissa-core
dependent_to.description:
Melissa is a file-avoiding, adaptive, fault-tolerant and elastic
framework, to run large-scale sensitivity analysis or deep-surrogate
training on supercomputers. This package builds the launcher and server
modules.

dependent_to.name: py-kornia
dependent_to.description: Open Source Differentiable Computer Vision Library for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-qpth
dependent_to.description: A fast and differentiable QP solver for PyTorch

dependent_to.name: py-torchmetrics
dependent_to.description: Machine learning metrics for distributed, scalable PyTorch applications.

dependent_to.name: py-torchaudio
dependent_to.description: An audio package for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-ogb
dependent_to.description:
The Open Graph Benchmark (OGB) is a collection of benchmark datasets,
data loaders, and evaluators for graph machine learning. Datasets cover
a variety of graph machine learning tasks and real-world applications.
The OGB data loaders are fully compatible with popular graph deep
learning frameworks, including PyTorch Geometric and Deep Graph Library
(DGL). They provide automatic dataset downloading, standardized dataset
splits, and unified performance evaluation.

dependent_to.name: py-ctgan
dependent_to.description:
CTGAN is a collection of Deep Learning based Synthetic Data Generators
for single table data, which are able to learn from real data and
generate synthetic clones with high fidelity.

dependent_to.name: py-heat
dependent_to.description:
Heat is a flexible and seamless open-source software for high
performance data analytics and machine learning. It provides highly
optimized algorithms and data structures for tensor computations using
CPUs, GPUs and distributed cluster systems on top of MPI.

dependent_to.name: py-continuum
dependent_to.description: A clean and simple data loading library for Continual Learning

dependent_to.name: py-lightning-fabric
dependent_to.description:
Fabric is the fast and lightweight way to scale PyTorch models without
boilerplate.

dependent_to.name: py-torchsummary
dependent_to.description:
Keras has a neat API to view the visualization of the model which is
very helpful while debugging your network. Here is a barebone code to
try and mimic the same in PyTorch. The aim is to provide information
complementary to, what is not provided by print(your_model) in PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-deepspeed
dependent_to.description:
DeepSpeed library. DeepSpeed enables world's most powerful language
models like MT-530B and BLOOM. It is an easy-to-use deep learning
optimization software suite that powers unprecedented scale and speed
for both training and inference.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-scatter
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a small extension library of highly optimized
sparse update (scatter and segment) operations for the use in PyTorch,
which are missing in the main package.

dependent_to.name: py-sdmetrics
dependent_to.description:
The SDMetrics library provides a set of dataset-agnostic tools for
evaluating the quality of a synthetic database by comparing it to the
real database that it is modeled after.

dependent_to.name: py-ci-sdr
dependent_to.description:
This repository contains an implementation for the Convolutive transfer
function Invariant Signal-to-Distortion Ratio objective for PyTorch as
described in the publication Convolutive Transfer Function Invariant SDR
training criteria for Multi-Channel Reverberant Speech Separation

dependent_to.name: py-ocnn
dependent_to.description:
O-CNN is an octree-based sparse convolutional neural network framework
for 3D deep learning.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-spline-conv
dependent_to.description:
This is a PyTorch implementation of the spline-based convolution
operator of SplineCNN.

dependent_to.name: py-gpytorch
dependent_to.description:
GPyTorch is a Gaussian process library implemented using PyTorch.
GPyTorch is designed for creating scalable, flexible, and modular
Gaussian process models with ease.

dependent_to.name: py-smartsim
dependent_to.description:
A workflow library to easily integrate machine learning libraries with
high performance computing simulations and applications

dependent_to.name: py-torch-cluster
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a small extension library of highly optimized
graph cluster algorithms for the use in PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-lightning
dependent_to.description:
The Deep Learning framework to train, deploy, and ship AI products
Lightning fast.

dependent_to.name: py-fastai
dependent_to.description:
You can use fastai without any installation by using Google Colab. In
fact, every page of this documentation is also available as an
interactive notebook - click "Open in colab" at the top of any page to
open it (be sure to change the Colab runtime to "GPU" to have it run
fast!) See the fast.ai documentation on Using Colab for more
information.

dependent_to.name: py-pyro-ppl
dependent_to.description: A Python library for probabilistic modeling and inference.

dependent_to.name: py-accelerate
dependent_to.description:
A simple way to train and use PyTorch models with multi-GPU, TPU, mixed-
precision.

dependent_to.name: py-thop
dependent_to.description: A tool to count the FLOPs of PyTorch model.

dependent_to.name: py-fairscale
dependent_to.description:
FairScale is a PyTorch extension library for high performance and large
scale training. This library extends basic PyTorch capabilities while
adding new SOTA scaling techniques.

dependent_to.name: py-pretrainedmodels
dependent_to.description: Pretrained models for Pytorch.

dependent_to.name: py-exarl
dependent_to.description:
A scalable software framework for reinforcement learning environments
and agents/policies used for the Design and Control applications

dependent_to.name: py-vector-quantize-pytorch
dependent_to.description:
A vector quantization library originally transcribed from Deepmind's
tensorflow implementation, made conveniently into a package. It uses
exponential moving averages to update the dictionary.

dependent_to.name: py-fastfold
dependent_to.description:
Optimizing Protein Structure Prediction Model Training and Inference on
GPU Clusters.

dependent_to.name: py-pytorch-lightning
dependent_to.description: PyTorch Lightning is the lightweight PyTorch wrapper for ML researchers.

dependent_to.name: py-minkowskiengine
dependent_to.description:
The MinkowskiEngine is an auto-differentiation library for sparse
tensors.

dependent_to.name: cosmoflow-benchmark
dependent_to.description:
This is a an implementation of the CosmoFlow 3D convolutional neural
network for benchmarking. It is written in TensorFlow with the Keras API
and uses Horovod for distributed training.

dependent_to.name: py-dgl
dependent_to.description:
Deep Graph Library (DGL). DGL is an easy-to-use, high performance and
scalable Python package for deep learning on graphs. DGL is framework
agnostic, meaning if a deep graph model is a component of an end-to-end
application, the rest of the logics can be implemented in any major
frameworks, such as PyTorch, Apache MXNet or TensorFlow.

dependent_to.name: py-torchtext
dependent_to.description: Text utilities, models, transforms, and datasets for PyTorch.
